slides.title: Human Body Systems
slides.content:
**Circulatory:** Heart, blood vessels
**Respiratory:** Lungs, breathing
**Digestive:** Stomach, intestines
**Nervous:** Brain, nerves
**Skeletal:** 206 bones
**Muscular:** Movement

slides.title: Plants and Animals
slides.content:
**Photosynthesis:** Plants make food using sunlight
**Food Chain:** Producer → Consumer → Decomposer
**Classification:** Kingdom, Phylum, Class, Order, Family, Genus, Species
**Mammals:** Warm-blooded, give birth to young

slides.title: Diseases
slides.content:
**Communicable:** TB, Malaria, COVID-19 (spread person-to-person)
**Non-Communicable:** Diabetes, Cancer, Heart disease
**Vaccines:** Prevent diseases
**Antibiotics:** Fight bacterial infections

question.questionText: How many bones are there in the adult human body?
question.explanation: An adult human body has 206 bones. Babies are born with about 270 bones, but many fuse together as they grow.
